edu.ncsu.csc216.checkout_simulator.simulation

Class Simulator

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.ncsu.csc216.checkout_simulator.simulation.Simulator

  • public class Simulator
extends java.lang.Object
    The Simulator class both runs the simulation and provideds step-by-step information by responding to events that are managed from the EventCalendar class.
    Author:
    Steven Mayo

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Simulator(int numRegisters, int numCarts)
      Constructor for the Simulator class that is used to create a Store object, and an array of CheckoutRegisters.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      double averageProcessTime()
      Calculates the average number of seconds that each cart took to process once reaching the front of the checkout line.
      double averageWaitTime()
      Calculates the average number of seconds that carts had to wait in checkout register lines prior to actually checking out.
      java.awt.Color getCurrentCartColor()
      Returns the color of the currentCart object or null if the currentCart is set to null.
      int getCurrentIndex()
      Returns the current index of the CheckoutRegister that is selected by the current Cart.
      int getStepsTaken()
      Returns the total number of steps taken so far.
      boolean itemLeftSimulation()
      Returns true if the most recently handled cart completed checking out and left a register line.
      boolean moreSteps()
      Checks to see if the simulation has finished or if more steps need to be handled.
      static java.awt.Color[] simulationColors()
      Returns the array of colors assigned to the different Cart types.
      static java.lang.String[] simulationLabels()
      Returns the array of strings describing the different Cart types.There are three string elements in the array: The ExpressCart label, the RegularShoppingCart label, and the SpecialHandlingCart label.
      void step()
      Handles the next available event from the EventCalendar.
      int totalNumberOfSteps()
      Returns the total number of steps that will be taken during the simulation.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • Simulator

        public Simulator(int numRegisters,
                 int numCarts)
        Constructor for the Simulator class that is used to create a Store object, and an array of CheckoutRegisters. This constructor also creates the Log to keep track of the statistics and creates an EventCalendar to control the order of events.
        Parameters:
        numCarts - The number of carts to simulate shopping within the Store.
        numRegisters - The number of CheckoutRegisters to instantiate for simulation.

    • Method Detail

      • simulationColors

        public static java.awt.Color[] simulationColors()
        Returns the array of colors assigned to the different Cart types. There are three elements within the array: The color for the ExpressCart, the color for the RegularShoppingCart, and the color for the SpecialHandlingCart.
        Returns:
        The array of simulation colors for each Cart variation.

      • simulationLabels

        public static java.lang.String[] simulationLabels()
        Returns the array of strings describing the different Cart types.There are three string elements in the array: The ExpressCart label, the RegularShoppingCart label, and the SpecialHandlingCart label.
        Returns:
        String array containing the three Cart labels.

      • step

        public void step()
        Handles the next available event from the EventCalendar.

      • getStepsTaken

        public int getStepsTaken()
        Returns the total number of steps taken so far.
        Returns:
        stepsTaken The total number of steps taken so far.

      • totalNumberOfSteps

        public int totalNumberOfSteps()
        Returns the total number of steps that will be taken during the simulation.
        Returns:
        The total number of steps to be taken during the simulation.

      • moreSteps

        public boolean moreSteps()
        Checks to see if the simulation has finished or if more steps need to be handled.
        Returns:
        True if the simulation is not finished, false otherwise.

      • getCurrentIndex

        public int getCurrentIndex()
        Returns the current index of the CheckoutRegister that is selected by the current Cart. If the currentCart is null, then -1 is returned.
        Returns:
        -1 or the current index of the CheckoutRegister for the currentCart.

      • getCurrentCartColor

        public java.awt.Color getCurrentCartColor()
        Returns the color of the currentCart object or null if the currentCart is set to null.
        Returns:
        The color of the currentCart object or null if the current cart is set to null.

      • itemLeftSimulation

        public boolean itemLeftSimulation()
        Returns true if the most recently handled cart completed checking out and left a register line. Returns false if the most recently handled cart left the shopping area to enter a register line or if there is no current cart.
        Returns:
        true if the most recently handled cart exited the simulation, false otherwise.

      • averageWaitTime

        public double averageWaitTime()
        Calculates the average number of seconds that carts had to wait in checkout register lines prior to actually checking out.
        Returns:
        The average number of seconds each cart waited in line before processing.

      • averageProcessTime

        public double averageProcessTime()
        Calculates the average number of seconds that each cart took to process once reaching the front of the checkout line.
        Returns:
        The average number of seconds each cart took to process.
